pullrequest.title: Adding cppcheck and cpplint with codecheck target

content.raw:
It depends a bit on what you intend the meaning of "relocatable" to be.

If by "relocatable", you mean (1) that a user can uninstall `ign-cmake` and then reinstall it somewhere else without breaking any dependent projects, then this is perfectly relocatable.

If by "relocatable", you mean (2) that someone can cut+paste their entire install directory (e.g. `bin`, `lib`, `share`) from one location to another, then this is not relocatable.

I think for cmake, "relocatable" typically refers to the first definition. CMake config-files (like this one) are expected to use full paths when referring to the files that their project is providing.
